Given <math display="inline">X \subseteq \mathbb{R}</math>, then we say <math display="inline">y</math> is the infimum or greatest lower bound of <math display="inline">X</math> if and only if <math display="inline">y</math> is an lower bound and <math display="inline">z \le y</math> for every other lower bound <math display="inline">z</math> of <math display="inline">X</math>, and we write <math>y = \operatorname{inf}(X)</math>
